channel.title: Meta
channel.description:
I guess I'll post this shit here since the section is dead.
https://github.com/AnthonyCalandra/meta
I've been working on a template metaprogramming library for C++11 which is a collection of metafunctions and metaclasses I used in my introduction to metaprogramming series. I also added basic (and kinda crappy) reflection capabilities, but due to the way TMP works I don't think I'll be able to get away with much without extensive macro use (PS: any ideas in this category are welcome).
Still a work in progress.

item.title: Meta
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:3, topic:554543”]list_c<int, 1, 2, 3> // == list<int_<1>, int_<2>, int_<3>>
You can’t infer the type from the input?[/quote]

Unfortunately no which makes the syntax a bit heavy. Type inference in this way is coming in C++17.

sini:

Im confused as to what the fudge this does lol

It’s basically a library that provides components for TMP use. An example of practical TMP is dimensional analysis, DSELs, or making generic containers (among others).

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4638935/examples-of-practical-usage-of-boostmpl (replace Boost.MPL with meta)
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/63494/does-anyone-use-template-metaprogramming-in-real-life

Read full topic

item.title: Meta
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

I guess I’ll post this shit here since the section is dead.

GitHub

AnthonyCalandra/meta

meta - Metaprogramming C++11 library built on top of std::type_traits.

I’ve been working on a template metaprogramming library for C++11 which is a collection of metafunctions and metaclasses I used in my introduction to metaprogramming series. I also added basic (and kinda crappy) reflection capabilities, but due to the way TMP works I don’t think I’ll be able to get away with much without extensive macro use (PS: any ideas in this category are welcome).

Still a work in progress.

Read full topic
